summary: This is an email correspondence from the defense attorneys for Ghislaine Maxwell, submitting her response to the government's notice regarding her Rule 17 subpoenas directly to the court. It involves procedural steps related to a protective order and indicates the document will be filed publicly after conferring with the government on redactions.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who sent the email submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's legal response to the court.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in the case U.S. v. Maxwell, to whom the correspondence is addressed.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who is listed as respectfully submitting the legal response alongside Nicole Simmons.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). Her legal team is submitting a response related to her Rule 17 subpoenas.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as copied on the email, indicating she is part of the defense legal team.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Listed as copied on the email, indicating she is part of the defense legal team.

connections.description: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca is a defense attorney submitting a legal response on behalf of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Nicole Simmons is a defense attorney submitting a legal response on behalf of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are attorneys at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. working together on Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judge over the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell.

events.title: Government's Notice Regarding Rule 17 Subpoenas
events.description: The government filed a notice concerning Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 17 subpoenas, to which this document is a response.

events.title: Defense Submission of Response to Court
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys submitted her response to the government's April 5 notice directly to the court, citing the protective order.

keyFacts: The document is a procedural filing in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, from the firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., is responding to a government notice regarding her Rule 17 subpoenas.
The response was submitted directly to Judge Nathan due to concerns about information covered by a Protective Order.
The defense indicates they will confer with the government on redactions before filing the response on the public docket.
The correspondence shows the ongoing legal maneuvering and procedural steps in Maxwell's case in April 2021.
